Federal student loan forgiveness and repayment programs have been in existence since the National Defense Education Act of 1958. These programs offer borrowers the opportunity to have their student loan debt forgiven or repaid in exchange for service in specific fields or professions. Currently, there are over 50 federal loan forgiveness and repayment programs available. Loan forgiveness and repayment programs are created by the federal government to forgive or repay a portion of an individual's student loan debt in exchange for service in specific fields or professions.
